newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-FERGUSON BACK IN SCOTTISH SQUAD AFTER 20 MONTHS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-FERGUSON BACK IN SCOTTISH SQUAD AFTER 20 MONTHS.

text.p: Everton's Duncan Ferguson, who scored twice against Manchester United on Wednesday, was picked on Thursday for the Scottish squad after a 20-month exile.
Glasgow Rangers striker Ally McCoist, another man in form after two hat-tricks in four days, was also named for the August 31 World Cup qualifier against Austria in Vienna.
Ferguson, who served six weeks in jail in late 1995 for head-butting an opponent, won the last of his five Scotland caps in December 1994.
Scotland manager Craig Brown said on Thursday: "I've watched Duncan Ferguson in action twice recently and he's bang in form. Ally McCoist is also in great scoring form at the moment."
Celtic's Jackie McNamara, who did well with last season's successful under-21 team, earns a call-up to the senior squad.
